text: Tanzania is expected to compete at the 2020 Summer Olympics in Tokyo. Originally scheduled to take place from 24 July to 9 August 2020, the Games have been postponed to 23 July to 8 August 2021, because of the COVID-19 pandemic. It will be the nation's thirteenth consecutive appearance at the Summer Olympics. ==Athletics== Tanzanian athletes achieved the entry standards, either by qualifying time or by world ranking, in the following track and field events (up to a maximum of 3 athletes in each event): ;Track & road events {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Result !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Alphonce Felix Simbu |align=left|Men's marathon | | |-align=center |align=left|Failuna Matanga |align=left|Women's marathon | | |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2020 Summer Olympics 2020 Category:2020 in Tanzanian sport
title: Tanzania at the 2020 Summer Olympics
